page.title: 06Footpaths
page.content: In the grounds of Rycote chapel there is part of a footpath called The Oxfordshire Way.From Rycote it goes to Albury ,through Tiddington,and on to Waterstock.It is not an old path but a leisure path.The old paths link the farms,hamlets and villages.There are only two places where the old footpaths go alongside the river-at Ickford and at Shabbington.The footpath from the church to Manor Farm at Shabbington goes past an earthwork,which looks like a long hump in the ground.It was covered in buttercups.Many of the fields with footpaths have herds of cattle;they come very close and can be frightening.We saw hedges with more than 10 plant types-Elder,Plum,Birch, Alder,Hawthorn,Dog Rose,Hazel,Rowan, Bramble,Sloe- in one small bit of hedge in the Shabbington area.We identified 10 different kinds of grasses.
